intro: Rauvolfia palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan roseroot, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Rauvolfia palawanensis thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in lowland forests.
